label: Heatit Z-TRM 2
info_overview:
FEATURES

  • Floor sensor
  • Built-in room sensor
  • External room sensor
  • Temperature limiter
  • Weekly program/setback via gateway or pilot wire
  • Multilevel sensor command class
  • Firmware updates (OTA)
  • Power metering
  • LED-diode
  • Can be used in connection with different NTC-sensors
  • Lock mode/child lock
  • Calibration
  • 8 associations
  • Supports encryption mode: S0,Â S2 Authenticated Class, S2 Unauthenticated Class
info_inclusion:
To include the thermostat to your home automation gateway, press Center (confirm) for 10 seconds.

The display will show OFF. Press Right (down) 4 times till you see Con in the display.

Now start add device in your home automation software.

Start inclusion mode by pressing Center (confirm) for approximately 2 seconds.

Adding mode is indicated in the display by some 'circling' LED segments in the display until the timeout occurs after 20 seconds or the module has been added in the network.

Confirmation will show Inc in the display. If inclusion fails, Err (error) will appear.

Leave programming mode by choosing ESC in the menu.

Your thermostat is ready for use with default settings.
info_exclusion:
To exclude the thermostat to your home automation gateway, press Center (confirm) for 10 seconds.

The display will show OFF. Press Right (down) 4 times till you see Con in the display.

Now start excluding device in your home automation software.

Start exclusion mode by pressing Center (confirm) for approximately 2 seconds.

Adding mode is indicated in the display by some 'circling' LED segments in the display until the timeout occurs after 20 seconds or the module has been excluded from the network.

Confirmation will show Ecl in the display. If exclusion fails, Err (error) will appear.

Leave programming mode by choosing ESC in the menu.

    1. Value = 1 - 100, 0.1C - 10.0C, default = 1.0C<\/p>

    Time interval between consecutive meter reports.
    Meter reports can also be sent as a result of polling.<\/p>", "size": 2, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 60, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 32767, "options": [] }, { "id": 25, "label": "Meter report delta value", "description": "Meter report delta value", "overview": "

    1. Value = 0 - 255, 0kWh - 25.5kWh, default = 1.0kWh<\/p>

    Delta value in kWh\u00a0between consecutive meter reports.
    Meter reports can also be sent as a result of polling.<\/p>", "size": 1, "bitmask": "00000000", "default": 10, "read_only": false, "write_only": false, "value_min": 0, "value_max": 255, "options": [] } ], "associations": [ { "id": 1, "label": "Lifeline", "max_nodes": 7, "controller": true, "description": "", "overview": "

    Lifeline. (Normally used by the Z-Wave Controller)
    Sends:
    - Device Reset Notifications
    - Thermostat Setpoint Reports

    Send Binary Switch Set commands representing the status of the internal relay.<\/p>" }, { "id": 3, "label": "Thermostat Internal Multilevel Sensor Reports", "max_nodes": 7, "controller": false, "description": "", "overview": "

parameters.label: Operation mode
parameters.overview:
Value = 0, Off (default)
Value = 1, Heating mode
Value = 2, Cooling mode (not implemented)
Value = 11, Energy saving mode

parameters.label: Sensor mode
parameters.overview:
Value = 0, F-mode, floor sensor mode
Value = 1, A-mode, internal room sensor mode (default)
Value = 2, AF-mode, internal sensor and floor sensor mode
Value = 3, A2-mode, external room sensor mode
Value = 4, P-mode, power regulator mode
Value = 5, FP-mode, floor sensor and power regulator mode

options.label: AF-mode, internal sensor and floor sensor mode
FP-mode, floor sensor and power regulator mode

parameters.label: Floor sensor type
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 0, 10K-NTC (default)
2. Value = 1, 12K-NTC
3. Value = 2, 15K-NTC
4. Value = 3, 22K-NTC
5. Value = 4, 33K-NTC
6. Value = 5, 47K-NTC

parameters.label: Temperature control hysteresis (DIFF I)
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 0 - 30, 0.3C - 3.0C (default is 0.5C)
When using a water-based heating, the recommended hysteresis is a minimum of 1.0C

parameters.label: Temperature display
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 0, Display setpoint temperature (default)
2. Value = 1, Display calculated temperature

parameters.label: Temperature report interval
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 0, Reporting of temperature disabled
2. Value = 1 - 32767, 1s - 32767s, default = 60s

Time interval between consecutive temperature reports.
Temperature reports can also be sent as a result of polling.

parameters.label: Temperature report hysteresis
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 1 - 100, 0.1C - 10.0C, default = 1.0C

The temperature report will be sent if there is a difference in temperature from the previous value reported,
defined in this parameter (hysteresis).
Temperature reports can also be sent as a result of polling.

parameters.label: Meter report interval
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 0, Reporting of metering values is disabled
2. Value = 1 - 32767, 1s - 32767s, default = 60s

Time interval between consecutive meter reports.
Meter reports can also be sent as a result of polling.

parameters.label: Meter report delta value
parameters.overview:
1. Value = 0 - 255, 0kWh - 25.5kWh, default = 1.0kWh

Delta value in kWhÂ between consecutive meter reports.
Meter reports can also be sent as a result of polling.

associations.label: Lifeline
associations.overview:
Lifeline. (Normally used by the Z-Wave Controller)
Sends:
- Device Reset Notifications
- Thermostat Setpoint Reports
- Thermostat Mode Reports

associations.label: Thermostat Binary Switch Set
associations.overview: Send Binary Switch Set commands representing the status of the internal relay.

associations.label: Thermostat Internal Multilevel Sensor Reports
associations.overview: Send Multilevel Sensor Reports for internal temperature sensor.

associations.label: Thermostat External Multilevel Sensor Reports
associations.overview: Send Multilevel Sensor Reports for external temperature sensor.

associations.label: Thermostat Floor Multilevel Sensor Reports
associations.overview: Send Multilevel Sensor Reports for floor temperature sensor.

commandclass.name: NO_OPERATION
commandclass.label: No Operation - used for PINGing a device.

notices: Endpoint 0 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 1 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 2 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 3 has no command class linked to the basic class.
Endpoint 4 has no command class linked to the basic class.
